page.title: 14Horticulture near Newent
page.content: The land to the north of Newent is light and sandy and very suitable for the growing of a large range of horticultural crops both in the open and in artificial environments in either glass houses or in polythene tunnels. Crops grown include lettuce, celery tomatoes and other popular salad crops. Recently other more exotic crops have been grown such as peppers, aubergines and courgettes, reflecting a more continental eating trend. The industry is highly competitive and the main concern is the high cost of heating during the winter. There was once a cooperative marketing system the LSA in this area known as The Scarr. This has been replaced by a new group GMS and by free marketing. There is stiff competition from local farms who offer 'pick your own'strawberries and fruit.
